text: She traced the letters he wrote in the dust on her desk.

text: The silence in the house felt heavier than usual
label: sadness

text: She stared at the old photo until her eyes burned
label: sadness

text: Every step felt like dragging a weight behind me
label: sadness

text: I watched the sun go down feeling nothing at all
label: sadness

text: His laughter echoed but I wasnt part of it

text: I wanted to speak but the words wouldnt come
label: sadness

text: The empty chair haunted me more than the memory
label: sadness

text: I held the jacket close breathing in what was left
label: sadness

text: I smiled so no one would ask questions

text: She avoided looking in the mirror that morning

text: My chest ached with a pain I couldnt name
label: sadness

text: The party lights blurred as tears filled my eyes
label: sadness

text: I stayed up waiting but no one knocked

text: Even the dog stopped wagging its tail around me

text: I sat on the bed still wearing yesterdays clothes
label: sadness

text: My voice cracked before I could say Im fine

text: The letter had no return address
label: sadness

text: He kept scrolling through old messages he never deleted

text: I felt like a ghost in my own room
label: sadness

text: The world moved but I didnt want to join in
label: sadness

text: Her phone lit up but it wasnt me
label: sadness

text: The laughter in the hallway felt far away
label: sadness

text: The train passed and I didnt wave this time
label: sadness

text: I wanted to cry but nothing came out
label: sadness

text: His name still shows up in my draft.

text: The clock struck midnight and the package arrived
label: surprise

text: I opened the drawer and found a letter I never wrote

text: She walked in wearing the same dress from the dream
label: surprise

text: The lights flickered twice then the music started
label: surprise

text: I wasnt expecting to see that face again
label: surprise

text: He pulled the curtain back and there it was
label: surprise

text: She blinked twice unsure if what she saw was real
label: surprise

text: I answered the door and froze

text: The voice behind me was not supposed to be there

text: She turned around holding a cake

text: The old photo blinked red for a second
label: surprise

text: I had just said his name when he walked in

text: The bus arrived three hours early empty
